page.title: 14FARMING IN A-J-M.
page.content: This is a farmed area and{dairying}is the main type of farming.However quite a few flocks of{sheep}are to be seen; they are not usually owned by farmers in this area but this land is rented out to them when no longer needed for the cattle.{Chickens,ducks and an odd {pig and quite a few horses}are kept. The{size}of farm varies between 40 and 240 acres and field size is about 4 acres.The{grass}is intensively managed and the land is rarely ploughed.The nearest{cattle market}is in Crewe on Mondays.A local beef farmer also mends tractors and other farming implements of which there seem to be many.Most of the farms are family concerns,only the biggest employ outside labour.Perhaps a quarter of the farms are tenanted. Other residents are involved in related jobs,ie.potato marketing board and there is a mobile farrier.
